results.title: The Clown princes of Hollywood. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam, Sterling Educational Films and Gregstan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
Explains that some of the early comedians like Charlie Chaplin and Harold Lloyd became Hollywood royalty, while others who made audiences laugh but never reached the top of the ladder were dubbed “clown princes”. Uses original silent footage to examine the different styles and personalities of some of the comedians, including Charlie Chaplin, Harold Lloyd, Larry Seman, Charlie Chase, Laurel and Hardy, Ben Turpin and Billy West.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam, Sterling Educational Films and Gregstan Productions

results.title: The Clown of God (K)
results.creator_credit: Gary McGivney, Ernest Troost, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A beautifully filmed adaptation of the Tomi de Paola story about Giovanni, the clown who juggled for a living during the Middle Ages. Now, old and penniless, he returns to his birthplace seeking refuge in the church on Christmas Eve. Watching the procession of gifts for the Holy Child, he offers the only gift he has - one last performance. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: The Clown
results.creator_credit: Richard Balducci, Arthur Cohn and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A shaggy dog, Clown, lives in Paris with a street urchin: the two are inseparable. One day Clown runs off while the boy plays with friends. Using a painting of Clown, the boy desperately tries to find his dog. He has nearly given up when he at last sees clown and rushes to embrace it. Joy turns to despair as the boy realises the dog has attached itself to a blind man. The boy walks away.

results.title: The Cloudmaker
results.creator_credit: Leah Miller, Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Animation, in which a tiny figure struggling in a gigantic electro-mechanical world challenges the viewer to think about how one can live, work and fit into, and find satisfaction in a large technological society. No commentary, music soundtrack only.

results.title: The Closet = Le Placard [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Francis Veber, Alain Poire, TF1 Films productions, EFVE, Canal+ and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The Closet is a farcical French comedy from writer/director Francis Veber (The Dinner game, Les Fugitifs, The Birdcage). Francois Pignon (Daniel Auteuil) is an accountant in a rubber factory, where he is regarded as boring, insignificant, disposable and ‘unmanly’. Pignon, estranged from his ex-wife and teenage son, is about to be fired, an event that he regards as catastrophic. His response to his impending unemployment is attempted suicide until his new neighbour (Michel Aumont) talks him out of that plan and into another - if Pignon pretends he is gay the company will not fire him for fear of seeming homophobic. The effects on Pignon’s life, of his decision to come out of the closet, are enormous and ricochet into the lives of family and colleagues. “The Closet” explores notions of homophobia, machismo, discrimination, work place relationships and sexuality in a comedic manner. Stars some of France’s finest actors - Daniel Auteuil, Gerard Depardieu, Michele Laroque, Thierry Lhermitte and Jean Rochefort. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Clock
results.brief_description: The Clock is a 24-hour video installation created from thousands of clips of clocks, watches and other references to time from film and television.

constellations_other.name: Taking it slow
constellations_other.description: Daniel Crooks' Phantom Ride offers a meditative journey through digital landscapes that make the viewer pause and reflect.

results.description:
The Clock is a 24-hour video installation created from thousands of clips of clocks, watches and other references to time from film and television. These are masterfully edited together and synced to the present moment in one mesmerising collage. The result is an epic journey through cinematic history as well as a functioning timepiece.

Minute by minute, hour by hour, hundreds of characters are jolted awake by alarms, run for trains, wait for lovers, or dream strange dreams. Stitched together from hours of cinematic history, The Clock gifts audiences the addictive joy of recognising favourite actors or scenes from beloved films, as well as being wildly compelling and dream-like itself.

Since debuting in 2010, The Clock has become one of the most seen and celebrated artworks of our time, winning the Golden Lion at the 2011 Venice Biennale, and attracting critical acclaim and enthusiastic audiences at gallery showings across the world.
description_for_label:
The Clock is a 24-hour video installation created from thousands of clips of clocks, watches and other references to time from film and television. These are masterfully edited together and synced to the present moment in one mesmerising collage. The result is an epic journey through cinematic history as well as a functioning timepiece.

Minute by minute, hour by hour, hundreds of characters are jolted awake by alarms, run for trains, wait for lovers, or dream strange dreams. Stitched together from hours of cinematic history, The Clock gifts audiences the addictive joy of recognising favourite actors or scenes from beloved films, as well as being wildly compelling and dream-like itself.

Since debuting in 2010, The Clock has become one of the most seen and celebrated artworks of our time, winning the Golden Lion at the 2011 Venice Biennale, and attracting critical acclaim and enthusiastic audiences at gallery showings across the world.

results.title: The Clinic
results.creator_credit: David Stevens, Bob Weis, Robert Le Tet, Generation Films and The Film House
results.brief_description: Take an innocent intern on his first day at a VD clinic, add in a bunch of doctors and nurses who have seen it all before then mix it all up with the craziest and funniest patients you’ll ever meet. That’s the recipe for this highly infectious comedy. Stars Chris Haywood and Simon Burke.

results.title: The Cline Affair (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Brings into sharp focus the difficult ethical and moral questions surrounding the burgeoning field of genetic manipulation. The intrigue which cloaked the affair is investigated and the uncertain future of gene therapy is examined

results.title: The Climates of North America
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film shows what climate is and how it shapes the vegetation and the life of the inhabitants of North America’s climatic regions - from the North Pole to the Tropic of Cancer.
